alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 7:02PM MST until July 28 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR AREAS JUST WEST OF KIRKLAND... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 659 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms between Kirkland and Yava. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Waterman Creek, North Fork Date Creek, Poplar Wash, Kirkland Creek, Alkali Wash, Bland Creek, Skull Valley Wash and Cottonwood Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area as storms are weakening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Yavapai County - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
